title: Mobile-Mining
author: Mobile-Mining
content: We are entering a seed round for our project and looking for crypto VC's / investors.Can anyone recommend good places to connect?Thank you in advance!

comments.author: Techdev
comments.body: Yes. A lot of VCs and investors on LinkedIn. If interested, we can have a discussion. Telegram: @ElevatedWarrior

comments.author: peerwallet
comments.body: Be careful, all the scammers on BCT will contact you!

comments.author: Mobile-Mining
comments.body: Quote from: peerwallet on January 27, 2023, 08:03:03 AMBe careful, all the scammers on BCT will contact you!I've had a few already! Thanks for the warning

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: maybe you can elaborate more about your project is doing the whitepaper and etc I have bunch of community VC but usually they do need some verification and KYC

comments.author: maxtra
comments.body: Quote from: Techdev on January 26, 2023, 02:46:26 PMYes. A lot of VCs and investors on LinkedIn. If interested, we can have a discussion. Telegram: @ElevatedWarriorI just wrote you on telegram.

comments.author: worldofcoins
comments.body: Hi, welcome to the forum. There are several ways to connect with crypto VCs and investors for a seed round. Here are some suggestions:Crypto-focused online communities and meetings, AngelList, events and conferences, Crypto VC firms, and Social media platforms. Remember to research any potential investors before reaching out to them.

comments.author: @sriyan
comments.body: Quote from: Mobile-Mining on January 26, 2023, 02:43:56 PMWe are entering a seed round for our project and looking for crypto VC's / investors.Can anyone recommend good places to connect?Thank you in advance!There are good places to find investors. 1. You can find this via LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter.2. Conducting AMA sessions in different crypto communities.3. Participate in an international conference.

comments.author: Billyscottland
comments.body: Quote from: Mobile-Mining on January 26, 2023, 02:43:56 PMWe are entering a seed round for our project and looking for crypto VC's / investors.Can anyone recommend good places to connect?Thank you in advance!Hi launched my project, looking for funding, found on the forum. The amount required was small, the investor gave 17.000$. If you need a large amount of funding you will not find on the forum.

comments.author: Porfirii
comments.body: Quote from: Billyscottland on July 24, 2023, 01:03:32 AMQuote from: Mobile-Mining on January 26, 2023, 02:43:56 PMWe are entering a seed round for our project and looking for crypto VC's / investors.Can anyone recommend good places to connect?Thank you in advance!Hi launched my project, looking for funding, found on the forum. The amount required was small, the investor gave 17.000$. If you need a large amount of funding you will not find on the forum.17.000$ is a very decent amount to start a small digital project, congratulations! If you have to code and/or build a business plan for free, for example, plus pay for different expenses like marketing, hosting, etc. it can mean a no-go in most cases, but finding a good equity partner who trusts on you and you can rely on is a blessing.I don't know how ambitious is the OP's project, but I'm happy to see that members with a good plan or idea here can find that kind of amounts to start or scale their business.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Quote from: Billyscottland on July 24, 2023, 01:03:32 AMHi launched my project, looking for funding, found on the forum. The amount required was small, the investor gave 17.000$. You're good if you managed to get an investor that have trusted your project with his/her $17k. Quote from: Billyscottland on July 24, 2023, 01:03:32 AMIf you need a large amount of funding you will not find on the forum.That's right because many of us here don't trust easily with the projects that are being launched. Also, many are aware of how these projects become a scam scheme that are trying to hide in the form of a crowdfunding.Anyway, there are specific groups and websites for these funding especially if you're in the tech sector. You have to present what you're up to and be good in the proposal with those angel investors.

comments.author: lixer
comments.body: Quote from: Porfirii on July 25, 2023, 09:58:58 AM17.000$ is a very decent amount to start a small digital project, congratulations! If you have to code and/or build a business plan for free, for example, plus pay for different expenses like marketing, hosting, etc. it can mean a no-go in most cases, but finding a good equity partner who trusts on you and you can rely on is a blessing.I don't know how ambitious is the OP's project, but I'm happy to see that members with a good plan or idea here can find that kind of amounts to start or scale their business.It's all a risk, $17k might not be a very big amount for some but it is not a small amount too, so someone who has trusted the guy with his project has taken the risk with his money, he probably has verified and confirmed everything before the investment but even after that, I would say investing in newly launched projects is nothing more than a risk these days because we all know that most projects don't come out to be what they preach initially.A large number of projects make very big promises, they create good-looking websites, their whitepaper is compiled with details and everything and those who read it will think it will be one of the greatest projects of all time, but sometimes, it doesn't work out, and the team abandons the project.
